content.text: Write down the time Tim leaves work.
Find how far Tim travels before he stops.
Find how long Tim stops for.
Tim stops on the way home.
Shade one square so that the diagram has 1 line of symmetry.
3 Put one pair of brackets into this calculation to make it correct.
Tim drives home from work.
The travel graph shows his journey.
Find the value of \(x\).
Give a geometrical reason for your answer.
Find the value of \(y\).
Give a geometrical reason for your answer.
Calculate.
Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places.
In a bag of counters, 6 of the counters are blue.
The arrow ( \(\downarrow\) ) on the probability scale shows the probability of picking a blue counter at random.
Work out the total number of counters in the bag.
The local time in Japan is \(3 \frac{1}{2}\) hours ahead of the local time in India.
Find the time in Japan when it is 21 45 in India.
Mia changes \(\$ 350\) into euros. The exchange rate is \(\$ 1=0.92\) euros.
Calculate the amount Mia receives.
euros
\(A B C\) is a straight line. \(B D\) is parallel to \(A E\).
Factorise.
10 Solve.
Complete the bar chart.
Write down the mode for week 2.
13 In May a shop makes a profit of \(\$ 542\). In June the shop makes a profit of \(\$ 600\).
The shop gives \(\frac{2}{5}\) of the profit from May to a charity.
Find the amount the shop gives to the charity.
The shop spends \(38\%\) of the profit from June on a fridge.
Find the amount the shop spends on the fridge.
Find the mean number of customers for the 5 days in week 2.
Kai opens his restaurant from Tuesday to Saturday each week. He counts the number of customers each day for two weeks.
The bar chart shows some of the results.
Meg invests \(\$ 2500\) at a rate of \(4.6 \%\) per year simple interest.
Work out the cost of hiring 2 road bikes for 3 days.
Write a formula for the cost, \(E\), of hiring an electric bike for \(d\) days.
The cost of hiring an electric bike for 6 days is the same as the cost of hiring a mountain bike for \(d\) days.
Find the value of \(d\).
The cost, \(M\), of hiring a mountain bike for \(d\) days can be written as \(M=35 d+5\).
Calculate the total amount of her investment at the end of 3 years.
The table gives information about the costs of hiring bikes.

table.html:
Type of bikeCost for first dayCost for each extra day
Road\(25\(20
Mountain\(40\(35
Electric\(70\(50

content.text: (a) Work out the actual distance between \(S\) and \(P\).
(b) Measure the bearing of \(S\) from \(P\).
\(E\) is 20 km from \(P\) on a bearing of \(070^{\circ}\).
On the scale drawing, mark the position of \(E\).
The scale drawing shows a path from \(S\) to \(P\). The scale is 1 cm represents 2.5 km.
Scale: 1 cm to 2.5 km
Sue describes the single transformation that maps shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\) as a translation by the vector \(\left(\begin{array}{l}7 \\ 1\end{array}\right)\).
Explain why Sue is incorrect.
On the grid, draw the image of shape \(A\) after a rotation of \(90^{\circ}\) anticlockwise about \((0,0)\).
The diagram shows a circle with centre \(O\).
Points \(K, L\) and \(M\) lie on the circumference of the circle.
Draw triangle \(K L M\) so that angle \(K L M=90^{\circ}\).
Describe fully the single transformation that maps shape \(A\) onto shape \(C\).
Points \(C\) and \(D\) lie on the circle.
Write down the mathematical name for the line \(C D\).
Complete the table of values for \(y=\frac{20}{x}\).
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=\frac{20}{x}\) for \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 5\).
20 A spinner is numbered 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.
Complete the table.
Rinesh spins the spinner another 1500 times.
Calculate the expected number of times the spinner lands on 2.
Use your graph to solve the equation \(\frac{20}{x}=8\).
NOT WRITE IN THIS MARGIN
Rinesh spins the spinner many times.
He works out the relative frequency that the spinner lands on each number.
Write these distances in order, starting with the shortest.
The radius of Earth is 6370 km.
Satellite \(A\) is \(k\) times further from the centre of Earth than satellite \(D\).
Show that \(k=6.11\) correct to 2 decimal places.
These are the distances above the surface of the Earth of five satellites, \(A, B, C, D\) and \(E\). Each distance is in kilometres.
A satellite travels at a speed of \(27 000 \mathrm{km / h}\).
Find the distance the satellite travels in 95 minutes.
22 The diagram shows a solid cylinder with height 10 cm.
The volume of the cylinder is \(478 \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\).
Find the radius of the cylinder.
The cylinder is made from gold.
The density of the gold is \(19.3 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{cm}^{3}\).
Calculate the mass of the cylinder.
[Turn over]
Calculate the value of \(h\).
Calculate the value of \(y\).
BLANK PAGE
BLANK PAGE
A different satellite travels at a speed of \(25 200 \mathrm{km / h}\).
Convert this speed into m/s.
